title: PREVIEW: Alphabet shares dip; seen reporting Q4 EPS, rev increases
text: ** Shares in Google's parent Alphabet Inc GOOG down 0.8% on Tuesday ahead of Q4 financial report due out after market close, with analysts expecting strongest rev growth in over a year ** Wall Street sees GOOGL reporting adj EPS of $1.59 vs $1.05 EPS in year-ago quarter on rev of $85.3 bln, which would be up 12.2% y/y according to the latest data from LSEG. That would be highest pct qtrly rev increase since June qtr in 2022 ** In the last 8 quarters GOOGL beat EPS and rev consensus 4 times as it missed expectations every quarter in 2022 ** The bulk of the search giant's rev comes from advertising with $66.1 bln ad rev expected for Q4, which would be almost 12% higher than year-ago, per LSEG ** Also in focus is the company's cloud computing business, which in the third quarter quarter grew 22.5%, its slowest pace since Q1 2021, sending its shares down after its report ** Earlier this month Google said it was laying off hundreds of employees in ad sales, marking the latest cuts at the co ** YTD GOOGL shares up 9% after soaring ~58% in 2023 vs S&P 500 communications services index S5TELS, which is up 9.6% so far in 2024 after rising 54% in 2023 ** GOOGL last traded at $152.27 vs median PT of $155.50 according to LSEG, which shows 51 analyst ratings: 13 'strong buy,' 29 'buy' ratings and 9 'hold' recommendations Traders and investors use our platform.
